title: The Learjet 45 uses Garrett TFE - - - 1B engines. The engine…
caption_en: The Learjet 45 uses Garrett TFE - - - 1B engines. The engine is a two-spool turbofan engine. I 1 o aa a o dy 4 1 I.

title: The low pressure spool or shaft is referred to as the N1 sha…
caption_en: The low pressure spool or shaft is referred to as the N1 shaft and consists of a four-stage axial compressor and a three-stage axial turbine.

title: The front of the N1 shaft drives a gearbox which in turn dri…
caption_en: The front of the N1 shaft drives a gearbox which in turn drives the single-stage axial fan. N1 shaft speed is sensed by an N1 sensor located at the rear of the N1 shaft.

title: The high pressure spool or shaft is referred to as the N2 sh…
caption_en: The high pressure spool or shaft is referred to as the N2 shaft and consists of a centrifugal compressor and a single stage axial turbine. It is concentric with the N1 shaft. J 1 o aa a o dy 4 1 I.

title: The N2 shaft also drives an accessory gearbox via shafts and…
caption_en: The N2 shaft also drives an accessory gearbox via shafts and a transfer gearbox. N2 shaft speed is sensed by an N2 sensor located at the transfer gearbox. J 1 o aa a o dy 4 1 I.

title: The accessory gearbox drives the startergenerator, AC altern…
caption_en: The accessory gearbox drives the startergenerator, AC alternator, hydraulic pump, motive flow pump, engine oil and fuel pumps, and the fuel control unit. These components are mounted in front and behind the accessory gearbox. J 1 o aa a o dy 4 1 I.

title: This modulates to prevent compressor surges. Fuel scheduling…
caption_en: This modulates to prevent compressor surges. Fuel scheduling is also controlled by the DEEC, which directs the correct amount of fuel from the FUEL Control Unit to the combustion chamber. J 1 o aa a o dy 4 1 I.

title: The combustion chamber is an annular type and there are two …
caption_en: The combustion chamber is an annular type and there are two ignitor plugs. Engine temperature is sensed by ten thermocouples spaced around the engine and located between the low and high pressure turbines. Engine temperature is referred to as or Interstage Turbine Temperature.

title: Each engine develops pounds of thrust, static at sea level u…
caption_en: Each engine develops pounds of thrust, static at sea level up to 32 degrees centrigrade. An automatic Performance Reserve system allows the maximum thrust to be increased to pounds under the same temperature conditions.
